thread.title: Cubs fans anticipate David Price acquisition before ALCS Game 6
thread.title_full: Cubs fans anticipate David Price acquisition before ALCS Game 6 | Chicago Sun-Times

author: | emailAddress.indexOf('@') == -1) {errorString = 'Please enter your email address';} var isError = false; if (errorString.length > 0) isError = true; if (isError) alert(errorString); return !isError;}
title: Cubs fans anticipate David Price acquisition before ALCS Game 6
text:
The Cubs have been eliminated from the playoffs after a tremendous 2015 season, and fans are already looking towards next season.
Expectations will be high for a Cubs team that finished as the hottest in baseball leading up to the playoffs. There weren’t many holes on a team that was built on a sturdy foundation of talent and youth, but even the fans realize how thin the team was at starting pitcher.
Besides Jake Arrieta and Jon Lester, the team’s starters were lackluster and most mediocre. In the playoffs, excellence wins series, not mediocrity.
The North Siders will need another big-time arm if they are to propel to the next level. Most of Cubs nation has their sights set on a particular lefty.
David Price, the Cubs No. 3 starter next year. pic.twitter.com/FZhpa7jPty
— Mod Rarinelli (@Mrocks8Sonny) October 24, 2015
Blue Jays David Price hadn’t finished pitching in Game 6 of the ALCS before fans starting making claims that he would be in Chicago next season.
And David Price leaves the mound as he heads towards a career-changing signing with the #Cubs
— ChiCitySports.Com (@ChiCitySports23) October 24, 2015
Regardless of how tonight ends, David Price can sleep tonight. The dude delivered.
— Pierre LeBrun (@Real_ESPNLeBrun) October 24, 2015
David Price is going to look great in a Cubs jersey next season
— Johnny (@Johnny_Smo) October 24, 2015
Sure Price may have all the talent, but will the Cubs be willing to pay his asking price?
